citations.narrative:
The animal records were not updated after the last inspection to include the dates of disposition for 93 chickens that were
transferred.
Per this Section, exhibitors shall make and maintain complete records that include the source, date of purchase,
acquisition, sale, or disposal of the animal(s). Complete information regarding all animal transfers is required to account
for animal dispositions. The facility corrected this item during the inspection by updating the animal records. To remain
corrected from this date 1/13/25 forward.

At the time of the inspection, one male adult rabbit and one tortoise were housed together in the same enclosure.
Per this Section, rabbits shall not be housed in the same primary enclosure with any other species of animals. Housing
rabbits with other species of animals can affect their health. Facility corrected this item during the inspection by moving
the rabbit and housing him individually in another enclosure. To remain corrected from this date 1/13/25 forward.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with facility representative.
*END OF REPORT*
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1)(v)  Repeat
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The animal records were not updated after the last inspection to include the dates of disposition for 93 chickens that were 
transferred. 
 
Per this Section, exhibitors shall make and maintain complete records that include the source, date of purchase, 
acquisition, sale, or disposal of the animal(s). Complete information regarding all animal transfers is required to account 
for animal dispositions. The facility corrected this item during the inspection by updating the animal records. To remain 
corrected from this date 1/13/25 forward. 
3.58(a) 
   
Classification and separation. 
At the time of the inspection, one male adult rabbit and one tortoise were housed together in the same enclosure. 
 
Per this Section, rabbits shall not be housed in the same primary enclosure with any other species of animals. Housing 
rabbits with other species of animals can affect their health. Facility corrected this item during the inspection by moving 
the rabbit and housing him individually in another enclosure. To remain corrected from this date 1/13/25 forward. 
 
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with facility representative.  
 
*END OF REPORT*
